thread.title: Bill Walton took off his T-shirt mid-broadcast
thread.title_full: Bill Walton took off his T-shirt mid-broadcast

author: USA TODAY
title: Bill Walton took off his T-shirt mid-broadcast
text:
Bill Walton took off his T-shirt mid-broadcast Bill Walton loves his tie-dye shirts. Post to Facebook Bill Walton took off his T-shirt mid-broadcast Bill Walton loves his tie-dye shirts.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/bill-walton-change-shirt-off-tie-dye-texas-espn-tom-herman-keep-austin-weird   Join the Nation's Conversation   Bill Walton took off his T-shirt mid-broadcast Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 7:20 p.m. ET Feb. 25, 2017 
Bill Walton received a shirt as a gift at the Texas vs. Kansas game that he was calling with Dave Pasch on ESPN on Saturday. He was so excited about it that he felt the need to change into it during the broadcast. ‚Äî ESPN College BBall (@ESPNCBB) February 25, 2017 
ESPN made sure they showed a replay of the moment just before going to commercial because fans definitely wanted to see this. 
Here it is with audio. Pasch and the people behind them look thrilled. rpmsports18: Bill Walton just changed his shirt in the middle of the ga‚Ä¶ ESPN College Baske‚Ä¶ https://t.co/Vn9EU2zICf pic.twitter.com/6DIZcnNCdg 
Texas football coach Tom Herman is the one who gave Walton the shirt. Walton was already wearing one of his tie-dye shirts, but he can never have too many. Longhorns @TexasFootball coach Tom Herman enabling Bill Walton's love of Tye-dye at today's game #HookEm #KeepAustinWeird ü§òüèªüèÄ pic.twitter.com/BjrvtJXnmL ‚Äî Texas Basketball (@TexasMBB) February 25, 2017 
I'm pretty if you give Walton any sort of tie-dye shirt, he'll happily change into it no matter what he's doing. Now seems like a good time to bring back the moment we gave Bill Walton an @ESPN_Esports shirt and he took off his shirt in a hotel lobby. pic.twitter.com/qpDjymRo4g ‚Äî Arash Markazi (@ArashMarkazi) February 10, 2017 
Tie-dye is his thing.
